metadata.name: Greek Language History
metadata.description: Stages of Greek from Ancient to Modern

entries.orthography: 24 letters; pitch accent; diacritics: acute, grave, circumflex, rough/smooth breathing
entries.pronunciation: β = /b/, γ = /g/, δ = /d/, θ = /tʰ/, φ = /pʰ/, χ = /kʰ/; long vs short vowels mattered
entries.grammar: Complex morphology; optative mood; dual number; multiple tenses
entries.phoneticExample: Ὅμηρος: ἄνδρα μοι ἔννεπε, Μοῦσα… / ˈhomɛːros ˈandra moi ˈennepe, ˈmusa…
entries.notes: Classical Greek forms the basis of most later Greek scholarship and literature.

entries.usage: Common spoken and written Greek; biblical texts; Hellenistic literature
entries.pronunciation: Shift toward stress accent; β → /v/ begins; γ softening
entries.grammar: Simplified morphology; optative less common; dative merges with genitive
entries.notableTexts: Septuagint, New Testament, early Hellenistic poetry
entries.phoneticExample: Ἐν ἀρχῇ ἦν ὁ λόγος / en arˈkʰɛː ɛːn ho ˈloɡos
entries.notes: Lingua franca of the eastern Mediterranean after Alexander the Great.

entries.orthography: Diacritics largely abandoned; monotonic writing emerges later
entries.pronunciation: Stress accent; β = /v/, γ = /ɣ/, δ = /ð/; vowels simplified
entries.notes: Transition period bridging Koine and Modern Greek; strong liturgical influence.

entries.usage: Spoken language, modern literature, official Greek
entries.orthography: 24 letters; monotonic system with tonos (´); sigma has final form ς
entries.pronunciation: Stress accent; η, ι, υ, ει, οι → /i/; consonants: φ = /f/, θ = /θ/, χ = /x/, γ = /ɣ/
entries.grammar: Simplified morphology; modern tense and mood system
entries.notes: Standard Modern Greek based on Demotic, official since 1976.
